vortex.gameentity

Class Camera

  • java.lang.Object
    • vortex.GameEntity
      • vortex.gameentity.Camera

  • public class Camera
extends GameEntity
    This class defines a Camera that can be used for any GameEntity. Camera's are basically like a viewport. They allow you to center on a certain point in 2D space and view all entities in a relative position to the Camera's point.

    The main Camera in any Game is accessed by Game.gameCamera. This gameCamera is the camera that will serve as the current viewport.

    Author:
    Daniel Stumpff

    • Constructor Detail

      • Camera

        public Camera(GameEntity entity)
        A constructor that takes an entity. The Camera's point will be located at the center of the GameEntity.
        Parameters:
        entity - The GameEntity to base this Camera's position on

      • Camera

        public Camera(GameEntity entity,
              float offsetX,
              float offsetY)
        A constructor with parameters. The Camera's point will be located at the center + offset of the GameEntity.
        Parameters:
        entity - The GameEntity to base this Camera's position on
        offsetX - The offset from the center in the x-axis
        offsetY - The offset from the center in the y-axis

      • Camera

        public Camera(GameEntity entity,
              float offsetX,
              float offsetY,
              float magnification)
        A constructor with parameters. The Camera's point will be located at the center + offset of the GameEntity.
        Parameters:
        entity - The GameEntity to base this Camera's position on.
        offsetX - The offset from the center in the x-axis
        offsetY - The offset from the center in the y-axis
        magnification - The magnification of the Camera (not currently implemented)

      • update

        public void update(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer gc,
                   int i)
        The update method for the Camera. Keeps the Camera in sync with the Entity.

        Note: If you override this method you MUST call the super or the Camera may not keep in sync.

        Overrides:
        update in class GameEntity
        Parameters:
        gc - The GameContainer for the game
        i - The amount of time that's passed since last update in milliseconds
